page.title: 17NEW ROMNEY BIRDS
page.content: HERONS ARE USUALLY FOUND IN DYKES, MARSHES AND BOGGY AREAS,HUNTING FOR PREY LIKE FISH OR FROGS.DOWN NEAR MY HOUSE THERE IS A DITCH WHERE A PAIR OF HERONS ARE NESTING.AT REST THEY STAND ON ONE LEG WITH THEIR EYES HALF CLOSED.HERONS ARE GRADUALLY DISAPPEARING FROM OUR MARSH BECAUSE OF CARELESS FISHERMEN AND CHEMICAL USERS. SOMETIMES I SEE A HERON ON OUR HOUSE ROOF BUT THAT DOESN'T COME ANY MORE PERHAPS IT HAS MOVED OR BEEN KILLED. PEOPLE IN NEW ROMNEY HAVE TO COVER THEIR PONDS WITH NETS TO PREVENT HERONS FROM STEALING THEIR FISH. AROUND OUR SCHOOL THERE USED TO BE A PAIR OF KESTRELS WHO HUNTED ON SOME ROUGH GROUND.NOW THEY HAVE GONE BECAUSE THE GROUND HAS BEEN CLEARED AND HOUSES BUILT THERE.
